avahi4j
Interface IServiceResolverCallback

All Known Implementing Classes:
TestServiceBrowser
public interface IServiceResolverCallback

Classes implementing this interface receive notifications from ServiceResolver objects when a service (as registered with the service resovler object) has been resolved.

Author:
gilles

Method Summary
 void resolverCallback(ServiceResolver resolver, int interfaceNum, Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto, ServiceResolver.ServiceResolverEvent resolverEvent, java.lang.String name, java.lang.String type, java.lang.String domain, java.lang.String hostname, Address address, int port, java.lang.String[] txtRecords, int lookupResultFlag)
          This method is called when a service has been resolved.
 

Method Detail

resolverCallback

void resolverCallback(ServiceResolver resolver,
                      int interfaceNum,
                      Avahi4JConstants.Protocol proto,
                      ServiceResolver.ServiceResolverEvent resolverEvent,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String type,
                      java.lang.String domain,
                      java.lang.String hostname,
                      Address address,
                      int port,
                      java.lang.String[] txtRecords,
                      int lookupResultFlag)
This method is called when a service has been resolved. The service details are given as arguments. Note that when a service is removed, the reported event is set to ServiceResolver.ServiceResolverEvent.RESOLVER_FOUND, but the other arguments are set to 0 and null. So take care when handling these arguments.

Parameters:
resolver - the ServiceResolver object who 's calling this method
interfaceNum - the interface number the service is registered on
proto - the service's protocol
resolverEvent - the event associated with the service. If ServiceResolver.ServiceResolverEvent.RESOLVER_FAILURE is received, all the other fields are meaningless.
name - the name of the service
type - the type of the service
domain - the domain where the service is registered
hostname - the name of the host offering this service
address - the address of the host
port - the port the service is running on
txtRecords - any TXT records associated with the service
lookupResultFlag - the lookup result flag LOOKUP_RESULT_* (See Avahi4JConstants)
